instructions:
Mash the garlic and sauté in the butter. Rub the meat with salt and flour and brown it well on all sides in
the butter. Lay the meat on a bed of thin-sliced onion in a large Dutch oven or any pot with a tight-fitting lid.
Add the butter, spices, and seasonings, and pour the rum or wine over the meat. *(A good pot roast will supply
most of its own juices, but as it cooks pour the 1/2 cup of water over it to make an ample supply of gravy)*.
Cover tightly and simmer for 3 or 4 hours until the roast is tender. If you want carrots with the pot roast, add
them to the pot for the last half-hour of cooking. Remove roast and carrots to a warm platter. Make gravy
with the possible addition of 1 jar of brown gravy and 1 envelope of brown gravy mix and the necessary
flour thickening.
ingredients: 1/2 cup rum or dry red wine
Small whole carrots, or large carrots quartered
1 envelope McCormick brown gravy mix and/or 1 jar brown gravy
name: Indian Pot Roast
